thread.title: ChatGPT-maker OpenAl is partnering with one of Google’s biggest partners and why this may not be good news for the company - Times of India
thread.title_full: ChatGPT-maker OpenAl is partnering with one of Google’s biggest partners and why this may not be good news for the company - Times of India

author: TOI Tech Desk
title: ChatGPT-maker OpenAl is partnering with one of Google’s biggest partners and why this may not be good news for the company - Times of India
text: OpenAI, the developer of the popular chatbot ChatGPT, is reportedly venturing into Google’s territory with plans for a web browser integrated with its AI technology. The company is actively pursuing partnerships, including one with Google’s long-time partner, to power specialised search features for various websites and apps, including those in the travel, food, real estate and retail sectors.Citing people who were briefed about the situation at OpenAI, a report by The Information says that the Microsoft-backed company has showcased prototypes and designs of these products to potential partners, including Condé Nast, Redfin, Eventbrite, and Priceline. These search features will leverage OpenAI's AI capabilities to provide more personalised and intuitive search experiences.OpenAI plans to power AI features in Samsung phonesFurthermore, OpenAI has reportedly engaged in discussions with Samsung to integrate its AI technology into the electronics giant’s devices. It is to be noted that OpenAI already supplies its AI technology to Apple.What makes this report interesting is that Samsung has already signed a long term partnership on AI and other areas that extend beyond Android. Rick Osterloh, SVP, platforms and devices at Google, shared a photo with TM Roh, president and head of MX Business, Samsung Electronics, on X.“Had a terrific conversation with TM and @SamsungMobile leadership. Our partnership has never been stronger. I'm thrilled about our collaboration on AI and the many opportunities ahead for both companies,” Rick Osterloh, SVP, platforms and devices at Google, said in a post on X.— rosterloh (@rosterloh) Samsung reshared the photo saying, “Our collaboration with @Google continues as we work towards a shared vision of delivering the best Android ecosystem of products and services. Exciting things are coming up for the future of AI-powered Android and Galaxy experiences.”·— SamsungMobile (@SamsungMobile) OpenAI searchGPT launchIn July, OpenAI announced that it is working on an experimental search product called SearchGPT with an aim to challenge Google’s long-standing dominance in the online search market.
